intro: Leschenaultia splendens var. stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers make it an attractive addition to rock gardens. It is also valued for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
